Chapter 2 Misc (Hedge, Powell, and Sumner 2018) talks about the difficulties, or paradox, that correlative research needs different data than experimental research. Another point made in this article is that: reliability in experimental research means: finding an effect realiable and little interindividual variance. reliability in correlational research means: ranking the subjects similar across time points: larger interindividual variance.
